title: About Me
text:
Hello! My name is Harmony Nguyen, and I’m currently a project coordinator in the Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab at Penn State University. I currently lead a longitudinal study examining parent-child interactions and anxiety transmission over time.
After earning my BA in Psychology from Cal Poly Pomona, I moved to Pennsylvania to pursue my research interests in parent-child interactions. I’m most interested in family stress and the contextual/environmental factors that influence the development of psychopathology. In my future career, I hope to leverage data to support non-profits aimed at supporting families and children’s health.
In my free time, I enjoy going to the gym, listening to music, and going to concerts. I am also an avid record collector! Below are some of my favorite songs of all time:
